00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief  Bottleneck strongly connected spanning subgraph problem 
00003  *          implemenation.
00004  *
00005  *  Implemenation of the bottleneck strongly connected spanning subgraph 
00006  *  problem (BSCSSP) that's used as a lower bound for the Bottleneck TSP
00007  *  objective value.
00008  *
00009  *  @author  John LaRusic
00010  *  @ingroup lib
00011  ****************************************************************************/
00012 #include "arrow.h"
00013 
00014 /****************************************************************************
00015  * Private function prototypes
00016  ****************************************************************************/
00017 /**
00018  *  @brief  Determines if the given graph is strongly connected.
00019  *  @param  problem [in] the problem instance
00020  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00021  *  @param  result [out] the result!
00022  */
00023 int
00024 strongly_connected(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int *result);
00025 
00026 /**
00027  *  @brief  Performs a recursive depth-first search to test for connectivity
00028  *  @param  problem [in] the problem instance
00029  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00030  *  @param  i [in] node index to search from
00031  *  @param  transpose [in] if true, calculates costs with transposed cost
00032  *              matrix
00033  *  @param  visited [out] array that marks nodes that have been visited
00034  */
00035 void
00036 strongly_connected_dfs(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int i, 
00037                        int transpose, int *visited);
00038                        
00039 /****************************************************************************
00040  * Public function implemenations
00041  ****************************************************************************/
00042 int
00043 arrow_bscssp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00044                    arrow_bound_result *result)
00045 {
00046     int ret;
00047     int low, high, median;
00048     int connected;
00049     double start_time, end_time;
00050     
00051     /* Start binary search */
00052     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00053     low = 0;
00054     high = info->cost_list_length - 1;
00055     while(low != high)
00056     {
00057         median = ((high - low) / 2) + low;
00058         
00059         /* Determine is graph is biconnected if we consider only costs less
00060          * than or equal to the median value. */
00061         ret = strongly_connected(problem, info->cost_list[median], 
00062                                  &connected);
00063         
00064         if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL)
00065         {
00066             result->obj_value = -1;
00067             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00068         }  
00069         else
00070         {
00071             if(connected == ARROW_TRUE)
00072                 high = median;
00073             else
00074                 low = median + 1;
00075         }
00076     }
00077     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00078     
00079     /* Return the cost we converged to as the answer */
00080     result->obj_value = info->cost_list[low];
00081     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00082     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00083 }
00084 
00085 int
00086 strongly_connected(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int *result)
00087 {
00088     int i;
00089     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00090     int *visited = NULL;
00091     
00092     /* Initialize arrays */
00093     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &visited);
00094     if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL) goto CLEANUP; 
00095     
00096     /* We start by assuming the graph is strongly connected */
00097     *result = ARROW_TRUE;
00098     
00099     /* Perform DFS from node 0 to see if we can reach every node */
00100     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00101         visited[i] = 0;
00102 
00103     strongly_connected_dfs(problem, delta, 0, ARROW_FALSE, visited);
00104     
00105     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00106     {
00107         if(!visited[i])
00108         {
00109             *result = ARROW_FALSE;
00110             goto CLEANUP;
00111         }
00112         visited[i] = 0; /* Clear values for next DFS */
00113     }
00114     
00115     /* Now perform the same search with the transposed cost matrix */
00116     strongly_connected_dfs(problem, delta, 0, ARROW_TRUE, visited);
00117     
00118     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00119     {
00120         if(!visited[i])
00121         {
00122             *result = ARROW_FALSE;
00123             goto CLEANUP;
00124         }
00125     }
00126     
00127 CLEANUP:
00128     if(visited != NULL) free(visited);   
00129     return ret;
00130 }
00131 
00132 void
00133 strongly_connected_dfs(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int i, 
00134                        int transpose, int *visited)
00135 {
00136     int j, cost;
00137     visited[i] = ARROW_TRUE;
00138     
00139     for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00140     {
00141         if((i != j) && (!visited[j]))
00142         {
00143             if(transpose)
00144                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, j, i);
00145             else
00146                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00147             
00148             if(cost <= delta)
00149             {
00150                 strongly_connected_dfs(problem, delta, j, transpose, visited);
00151             }
00152         }
00153     }
00154 }
